info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Montgomery and northeastern Chester Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 650 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester Springs, or 8 miles north of West Chester, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Phoenixville, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Valley Forge, Paoli, Chester Springs, Pughtown, Lionville, Cedarville, Lionville-Marchwood, Skippack, Spring City, Malvern, Evansburg, Audubon, Eagleville, Kenilworth, Chesterbrook and Trooper. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 312 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Pennsylvania.
